intro: Triumfetta speciosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or red-rooted triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
